questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: What is the value of angle α in a triangle where one exterior angle measures 145° and an adjacent interior angle is 60°?

content_zh.stem: What is the value of angle α in a triangle where one exterior angle measures 145° and an adjacent interior angle is 60°?

questions.explanation_en: By the Exterior Angle Theorem, the exterior angle equals the sum of the two remote interior angles: 60° + α = 145°, so α = 85°.
questions.explanation_zh: By the Exterior Angle Theorem, the exterior angle equals the sum of the two remote interior angles: 60° + α = 145°, so α = 85°.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G8-MATH-001 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A school choir has 84 students. The ratio of boys to girls is 3:4. After auditions, 12 new girls join and 6 boys leave. What is the new ratio of girls to boys?

content_zh.stem: A school choir has 84 students. The ratio of boys to girls is 3:4. After auditions, 12 new girls join and 6 boys leave. What is the new ratio of girls to boys?

questions.explanation_en: Original: 36 boys, 48 girls. After changes: 30 boys, 60 girls. New ratio: 60:30 = 2:1.
questions.explanation_zh: Original: 36 boys, 48 girls. After changes: 30 boys, 60 girls. New ratio: 60:30 = 2:1.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G8-MATH-002 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A baseball cap contains 9 baseballs: 4 blue, 3 white, 2 orange. A player selects 3 one at a time without replacement. What is the probability that none are blue?

content_zh.stem: A baseball cap contains 9 baseballs: 4 blue, 3 white, 2 orange. A player selects 3 one at a time without replacement. What is the probability that none are blue?

questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G8-MATH-004 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A plumber charges $50 for a house call plus $35 per hour. If the total bill was $207.50, how many hours did the plumber work?

content_zh.stem: A plumber charges $50 for a house call plus $35 per hour. If the total bill was $207.50, how many hours did the plumber work?

questions.explanation_en: Set up equation: 50 + 35h = 207.50. Subtract 50: 35h = 157.50. Divide: h = 157.50/35 = 4.5 hours.
questions.explanation_zh: Set up equation: 50 + 35h = 207.50. Subtract 50: 35h = 157.50. Divide: h = 157.50/35 = 4.5 hours.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G8-MATH-101 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A 13-foot ladder leans against a wall. The base of the ladder is 5 feet from the wall. How high up the wall does the ladder reach?

content_zh.stem: A 13-foot ladder leans against a wall. The base of the ladder is 5 feet from the wall. How high up the wall does the ladder reach?

questions.explanation_en: Using Pythagorean theorem: a² + b² = c². So 5² + b² = 13² → 25 + b² = 169 → b² = 144 → b = 12 feet.
questions.explanation_zh: Using Pythagorean theorem: a² + b² = c². So 5² + b² = 13² → 25 + b² = 169 → b² = 144 → b = 12 feet.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G8-MATH-102 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Triangle ABC has vertices A(1, 2), B(4, 2), and C(4, 6). If the triangle is reflected over the y-axis, what are the new coordinates of vertex B?

content_zh.stem: Triangle ABC has vertices A(1, 2), B(4, 2), and C(4, 6). If the triangle is reflected over the y-axis, what are the new coordinates of vertex B?

questions.explanation_en: Reflection over the y-axis negates the x-coordinate: B(4, 2) → B'(−4, 2).
questions.explanation_zh: Reflection over the y-axis negates the x-coordinate: B(4, 2) → B'(−4, 2).
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G8-MATH-103 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Which of the following numbers is irrational?

content_zh.stem: Which of the following numbers is irrational?

questions.explanation_en: 0.333... = 1/3 (rational), sqrt(49) = 7 (rational), −7/4 (rational). sqrt(50) cannot be expressed as a fraction, so it is irrational.
questions.explanation_zh: 0.333... = 1/3 (rational), sqrt(49) = 7 (rational), −7/4 (rational). sqrt(50) cannot be expressed as a fraction, so it is irrational.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G8-MATH-105 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G8-MATH-107 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: SpaceX's Starship carries x tons of payload and the booster weighs y tons. Together they weigh 5,000 tons fully fueled. The booster weighs 3,400 tons more than the payload. What is the payload capacity (x)?

content_zh.stem: SpaceX's Starship carries x tons of payload and the booster weighs y tons. Together they weigh 5,000 tons fully fueled. The booster weighs 3,400 tons more than the payload. What is the payload capacity (x)?

questions.explanation_en: Set up: x + y = 5000 and y = x + 3400. Substitute: x + (x + 3400) = 5000 → 2x = 1600 → x = 800 tons.
questions.explanation_zh: Set up: x + y = 5000 and y = x + 3400. Substitute: x + (x + 3400) = 5000 → 2x = 1600 → x = 800 tons.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question G8-MATH-108 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)
